intro: Sisyrinchium scirpiforme, commonly known as the slender blue-eyed grass, is a member of the Iridaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist to wet habitats, such as marshes and prairies. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, showy blue or violet flowers in late spring to early summer. Its flowering stems are usually slender and can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. Sisyrinchium scirpiforme is often found in the eastern and central United States, where it thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments.
